page.description: Public user defined function. The EMAIL_POP_RETR_UI() function displays the Download Email dialog box and returns a count of messages on your email server that match your filter specifications.
page.syntax: Message_Count as N = email_pop_retr_ui([C profile [,C inbox [,L lDisplay [,L lUI [,C filter [,L lStatusWindow [,L lStatusBar [,C parent_dlg_title [,L lSilent ]]]]]]]]])

argument.name: Message_Count
argument.description: The number of messages on the email server that match you filter. Character

argument.name: profile
argument.description: Optional. Default = active email profile (can be retrieved using EMAIL_GET_ACTIVE()). The name of the email profile to use. Character

argument.name: inbox
argument.description: Optional. Can be used to override the inbox specified in the Profile above. Character

argument.name: lDisplay
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .T. .T. = displays the Email Reader after downloading mail, .F. = does not display Email Reader.

argument.name: lUI
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .T. .T. = displays a dialog allowing the user to download selected mail, delete messages, filter, etc. .F. = does not display dialog.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Character. Optional. Default = "" (all messages). An email filter that can be built with A5_EMAIL_FILTER_BUILDER(). Allows you to download only messages matching certain criteria.

argument.name: lStatusWindow
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .T. .T. = displays a window with the current download progress, .F. = does not display progress

argument.name: lStatusBar
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. .T. = displays current progress on the Status Bar. .F. = does not display progress

argument.name: lSilent
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .F. .T. = suppresses all errors, .F. = displays all errors.
